intro: Hieracium crebriserratum, commonly known as the serrated hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are deeply serrated. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from June to September, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium crebriserratum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
